title: Comparing Movie Ratings: A Graphical Display
question_text:
A random sample of $90\text{ adults}$ and a random sample of $90\text{ kids}$ were asked to provide their opinion on a recently released superhero movie they had seen at the theater. Results of the survey are displayed below.

Choice 'C' is the correct choice since it provides a statement that is not supported by the graphical display.

Explanation of Distractors

Choice 'A' is incorrect because this statement is supported by the graphical display. The response "Excellent" is displayed in blue and the response "Good" is displayed in red. These two colors are right next to each other at the start of each bar graph. For adults, the combined blue and red portion of the bar does not reach to
60

50

50

of both groups said "Good" or "Excellent", more than half of those surveyed responded with one of these two words.

Choice 'D' is incorrect because this statement is supported by the graphical display and the fact that the same number of kids and adults were surveyed. The response "OK" is represented in green on both graphs. It is visually obvious that green represents a bigger portion of the adults' bar graph than the kids' bar graph.

Choice 'E' is incorrect because this statement is supported by the graphical display. The blue portion of the kids' graph is about twice as large as the blue portion of the adults' graph and the same number of adults and kids were surveyed.
